title.text: What Game Theory can do for NLG: the case of vague language

abstractContent.text: This informal position paper brings together some recent developments informal semantics and pragmatics to argue that the discipline of Game Theory is well placed to become the theoretical backbone of Natural Language Generation.
To demonstrate some of the strengths and weaknesses of the Game-Theoretical approach , we focus on the utility of vague expressions.
More specifically, we ask what light Game Theory can shed on the question when an NLG system should generate vague language.
